metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18065 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
_set_key in agent/helpers/table_container.c in Net-SNMP before 5.8 has a NULL Pointer Exception bug that can be used by an authenticated attacker to remotely cause the instance to crash via a crafted UDP packet, resulting in Denial of Service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsnmp-base - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
libsnmp-perl - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
libsnmp30 - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
python-netsnmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
snmp - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
snmpd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
snmptrapd - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
tkmib - 5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: net-snmp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.3+dfsg-1.8ubuntu3.1').
